profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid prepared using Describing Archives: a Content Standard

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: The Sierra Club branch in Los Angeles, California was founded by Phil Bernays and some fellow Sierrans in 1911. The Chapter originally provided leadership for hiking trips into the local mountains and High Sierra, and helped spread the word of John Muir. The collection consists of conservation issues and administration files including Southern California region minutes (1951-84), chapter newsletters and other publications, and assorted conservation issue materials related to the Sierra Club Angeles Chapter.
did.langmaterial: Finding aid is written in English.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of California, Los Angeles. Library Special Collections.

did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact UCLA Library Special Collections for paging information.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact UCLA Library Special Collections for paging information.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UC Regents. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

acqinfo.head: Provenance/Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Sierra Club Angeles Chapter, 1977-. The 2012 addition consisting of the Alice E. Knapp papers was transferred from UC Berkeley, Bancroft Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Note
processinfo.p: Processed by Evert Volkersz, 1967; 2012 addition processed by Courtney Dean with the assistance of Jillian Cuellar in the Center for Primary Research and Training.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Sierra Club Angeles Chapter records (Collection 1199). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: The Sierra Club is a nonprofit organization in the U.S. and Canada that works to promote and protect natural resources; it was founded in San Francisco (1892) by the naturalist John Muir who was the first president (1892-1914); by the late 20th century the club grew to an approximate 540,000 members; local chapters organize conferences, lectures, films, exhibits, and various expeditions; it publishes reports, magazines, books, and special publications and has numerous committees working to educate the public on environmental issues and lobbying local, state, and federal bodies for environmental legislation.

The Sierra Club branch in Los Angeles, California was founded by Phil Bernays and some fellow Sierrans in 1911; the Southern California Chapter, as it was originally known, stretched from San Luis Obispo to the Mexican border to the California desert; Muir Lodge in Big Santa Anita Canyon was Club headquarters from October 4, 1913 until its destruction in the great storm of 1938; the Chapter originally provided leadership for hiking trips into the local mountains and High Sierra and helped spread the word of John Muir.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists primarily of material related to the Sierra Club Angeles Chapter. Includes conservation issues and administration files including Southern California region minutes (1951-1984), chapter newsletters and other publications, and assorted conservation issue materials. Also includes newsletters published by various sections of the club.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: COLLECTION CONTAINS DIGITAL MATERIALS: Special equipment or further processing may be required for viewing. To access digital materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Sierra Club Oral History Project (Collection 329). Available at Library Special Collections, UCLA.
Collection of ephemera related to the Sierra Club (Collection 1197). Available at the Library Special Collections, UCLA.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This series consists of materials from the 2012 addition and was processed in 2012 by Courtney Dean.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series consists of 37 photo albums and scrapbooks compiled by Alice E. Knapp, containing items from 1917-1984, with the bulk of material from the early 1920s to mid 1930s. Albums primarily document her participation in Angeles Chapter activities, and feature a wealth of images of Southern California landscape and various chapter members. Also included in the albums are clippings from the chapter’s outings schedule; annotations and typewritten narrative accounts; and a number of botanical samples. Approximately 7 albums are exclusively related to Knapp’s personal life and her son Woolsey Ernest Knapp who was killed in WWII.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged in alphabetical order by subject, reflecting the given album titles.
